document_title: Orchitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Orchitis can be optimally prevented with daily living habits. To minimize the risk of infection, especially urinary tract infections, living environments and bathroom areas need to be kept hygienic to reduce the risk of infection.
In addition, using safe measures when having sex is an important factor to help protect your health. Using condoms not only helps reduce the risk of orchitis but also helps men and their partners minimize other sexually transmitted diseases.
Optimal measures to prevent orchitis:
Carry out mumps vaccination; Practice all safe sex measures to avoid the risk of STDs; Maintain clean living environment and build clean and hygienic living habits; Boys reach the age when they need to be circumcised at the right time; Reduce the number of sexual partners; Treat orchitis early in the acute stage and limit recurrence to avoid the risk of chronic orchitis

Call the hotline 0287 102 6789 - 093 180 6858 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 - 024 7106 6858 (Hanoi) to register for a private medical appointment with a specialist, through the customer service staff.; Register for a medical appointment with any doctor you trust at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage or Tam Anh General Hospital Urology and Andrology Fanpage; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
Orchitis is a common urinary disease in men. The disease can occur in all subjects and ages. However, people who are or have just recovered from mumps and have sexually transmitted diseases are at higher risk of orchitis than others.
The disease rarely affects fertility in men. However, if the disease is not treated promptly, the patient will face other complications, which can affect urinary health, testicular function and fertility.
